content.statement: vascular:venous:svd-001b-gsv-anatomy-detail is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Venous that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:venous:svd-001b-gsv-anatomy-detail helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:venous:svd-001b-gsv-anatomy-detail include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:venous:svd-001b-gsv-anatomy-detail.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

anatomic_landmarks.origin: Medial marginal vein, anterior to medial malleolus
anatomic_landmarks.leg_course: Within saphenous compartment, behind medial tibial condyle
anatomic_landmarks.sfj_relation: Medial to femoral artery, anterior to femoral vein

ultrasound_identification.saphenous_eye: GSV within hyperechoic saphenous fascia above and muscle fascia below
ultrasound_identification.location: Medial leg and thigh, superficial to deep fascia
ultrasound_identification.sfj_identification: End of GSV into common femoral vein, confirm femoral artery laterally

presentation: Visible varicose veins along GSV distribution
Symptoms worse with standing, better with elevation
Leg heaviness and aching along medial leg/thigh
Skin changes in gaiter area with advanced disease
diagnosis: Duplex ultrasound - gold standard for mapping
Identify saphenous eye to confirm GSV (not tributaries)
Measure diameter at SFJ and multiple levels
Assess reflux with Valsalva and distal compression
treatment: Preserve if suitable for arterial bypass conduit

definition.@value: The detailed anatomic course, relationships, and tributary patterns of the great saphenous vein from its origin at the medial foot to its termination at the saphenofemoral junction, essential for diagnosis and treatment of superficial venous disease.

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the course of the GSV from origin to termination
Identify the saphenous compartment and saphenous eye on ultrasound
Name the major tributaries of the GSV at each level
Locate the SFJ relative to anatomic landmarks
clinical_pearls: The 'saphenous eye' on ultrasound confirms you're looking at the GSV, not a tributary
SFJ is 2-4cm below inguinal ligament - not at the groin crease
Accessory saphenous veins are common and can be independent sources of reflux
Always assess GSV for suitability as bypass conduit before ablation
Duplicated GSV occurs in 8-15% of limbs - map the entire vein

medicalCode.description: Asymptomatic varicose veins of unspecified lower extremity
